etymology.description: 纯(純) (chún, "pure") and 素(素) (sù, "simple; plain; vegetarian") come together to describe a diet or lifestyle free of animal products. The use of 素(素) (sù, "simple; plain; vegetarian") has historical roots as a term for vegetarianism, and 纯(純) (chún, "pure") emphasizes the complete exclusion of animal-derived ingredients.
etymology.interpretation: The term 纯素(純素) (chúnsù, "vegan") reflects an emphasis on a wholly plant-based lifestyle, avoiding any animal products. By combining the ideas of purity and simplicity or plainness, it effectively conveys a focus on ethical and dietary clarity.

examples.chinese: 我只吃纯素食物(我只吃純素食物)。
她开了一家纯素餐厅(她開了一家純素餐廳)，提供各种美味菜肴(提供各種美味菜餚)。
examples.pinyin: Tā kāile yī jiā chúnsù cāntīng, tígōng gèzhǒng měiwèi càiyáo.
examples.english: She opened a vegan restaurant, offering a variety of delicious dishes.

examples.chinese: 选择纯素生活(選擇純素生活)，关爱动物(關愛動物)。
examples.english: Choose a vegan lifestyle, care for animals.
